This man's wound clearly hasn't fully healed, yet he insists that he's fit for returning to duty. The night may have returned and all, but this one's a headache any time of day!
My commanding officer demanded that I take leave to rest my wounds, so here I am. If I had my way of it, I'd rather be back at my post, fighting the good fight with my brothers- and sisters-in-arms.
To think that an attack of that scale and scope would hit while I was away. I just hope that my comrades are safe...

Just when I was about to be reinstated for duty, I suffered another wound in the attack the other day. Now, my superiors have prolonged my leave of absence indefinitely. \\<sigh> At this rate, I'll be an old hag before I return to active service...

When I saw the Light flood back into the sky, I immediately packed my things and went to report for duty. Sure enough, my superiors sent me straight back here. Why can't they see that I'm still able to fight!?

With peace having returned to Lakeland, they've even less of a use for me back at the outpost. That said, soaking in these soothing waters and gazing at the starry skies every night...maybe it's not such a bad life after all.
Welcome to the Wandering Stairs, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>! That's the name of my place, and a warning, too!
Enjoy a drink, but mind the steps on your way out─many's the drunkard who's taken a tumble, only to wake up in the infirmary.
Surprised? “Stunned” is more like it─I even left the bar unattended when I rushed out to take a look. The first night sky in a hundred years, and I could barely see it for the tears in my eyes...
Have you spoken to our hunters yet? I'm still waiting on one of you to take down a Virtue, and bring glory to the Stairs!
The Exarch tells me that you and he share a homeland...so I'm thinking that makes you more than some simple traveler.
Not that I mean to pry, you understand. I'm just hoping you'll be there to even the odds when push comes to shove with Eulmore.

Ah, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>. Fancy a cup of mulled wine? After hearing about that Lakeland Warden, I heated up a few bottles for the customers─you know, something to soothe the nerves.
Things seem to have calmed down with the eaters, so the Stairs is back to business as usual. Why don't you stay and have a pint, if you're not too busy?
The sky... That beautiful night sky... We only had it for a short while, but by the shadow do I miss it...
A good, strong pint to see you down the road? ...Ah, best not, eh? You'll need your wits about you by the sound of things.
Tell you what: I'll put aside one of my finest bottles, and you can have a bracing victory drink when you return!
Welcome back! I don't know exactly what you did, but I do know we owe you thanks for bringing the stars back to our skies!
Even with the Light gone, though, it seems the stray eaters didn't get the message. Not that I'm asking you to run around and slay them all yourself, of course...
All hail the great hunter! Things have certainly changed around here since you first walked in─Cyella's attitude not least of all.

That lass always seemed to have a cloud hanging over her, as much as she tried to hide it, but now I see her laughing and talking with the customers like she actually <Italic>1</Italic>enjoys<Italic>0</Italic> it. Stranger things, I suppose...
I tell you, Glynard's too nice for his own good. Letting regulars run up tabs and holding off on calling in debts. This is a business, not a charity...

So the night comes, which is bloody grand, but then he goes and shouts, “Drinks on the house for the next hour,” which is bloody mad. How does Glynard expect us to stay afloat with him making gestures like that?
Easy come, easy go. I half expected things to take a turn for the worse, so it's not much to me, but I spied Glynard alone in the storeroom the other day, wiping tears from his face...

Glynard seems to have pulled himself together, thank the gods. Seeing him moping about was starting to wear on me. Bad as it'd be for the coffers, I'd welcome an occasion for him to offer free drink again.
Well, it happened. The night reclaimed, the Warriors of Darkness triumphant, drinks on the house. We'll pay for it later, but for now...at least Glynard got his moment.
Head south from here, and you'll reach Amh Araeng. To the west lies the village of Sullen. Whichever way you mean to travel, be wary. The open road's a dangerous place to be these days.
They call this place the Bridges. Why, you say? Well, do you see that rock formation above us? What does it look like to you?

The vast wood that stretches out before the gate is known as the Forest of the Lost Shepherd. Legend has it that long ago, a young shepherd set out into the woods to find a missing lamb, but never returned.
Quite a sight of the Crystal Tower to be had from here, eh? Take a moment to appreciate it before you move on.

The Exarch Gate─that's what they call the stretch of land ahead of us, you see─is the de facto front doorstep of the Crystarium. It's stoutly protected by a number of strongholds, first and foremost of which is Fort Jobb.
The road north from here will lead you to Holminster Switch. Turn off the road midway there and you'll find the Rak'tika Greatwood, but you'd be wise not to venture too deep within.
